funFacts.label: Mega-PR Moment
funFacts.detail: Your biggest swing was “Capsule async support” in media_analyzer: +89325/-2438 lines — a full-on architecture upgrade, not just a refactor.

funFacts.label: Quarterback Energy
funFacts.detail: You shipped code and coached harder: 269 reviews given, with @cloudinary-pkoniu (47) and @netaeiny (38) as your top collab partners.

funFacts.label: Q1 Was a Launchpad
funFacts.detail: Q1 led the year with 77 merged PRs — including early-year foundation work and a test avalanche that set the pace.

funFacts.label: Testing Tsunami
funFacts.detail: One PR alone (“Add some tests” in captain-crash-lambda) dropped +16956/-26 lines — the kind of coverage boost that makes on-call quieter.

funFacts.label: Low-Drama Deletions
funFacts.detail: You added 133515 lines but only removed 8226 — lots of net-new capability, with cleanup sprinkled in (including a satisfying -98 purge).

bigRocks.title: Capsule Goes Async (The Big Switch)
bigRocks.impact: Introduced truly asynchronous AI Vision analysis with continuation tokens and async RPC flow, unlocking scalable model execution.

bigRocks.title: S3-Backed Async Responses
bigRocks.impact: Moved async response handling onto S3, reducing pressure on synchronous paths and making result retrieval more resilient.

bigRocks.title: Captain Crash: From Bot to Incident Wingman
bigRocks.impact: Built out Captain Crash’s AI + Slack plumbing (assistant integration, summarization guardrails, alert hygiene) to speed up incident triage.

bigRocks.title: Permissions Power-Ups
bigRocks.impact: Shipped multiple granular-permissions improvements across folders/assets/metadata, tightening enforcement without breaking workflows.

bigRocks.title: ECS Shutdown: Graceful, Not Hopeful
bigRocks.impact: Implemented graceful ECS task shutdown behavior so deployments and scale events stop being a game of chicken.

quarterlyActivity.highlights: Foundation season: big feature drops (Watermark + IQA) plus Captain Crash’s early build-out and guardrails.
Permissions + API craftsmanship: resource-by-IDs endpoints, enforcement polish, and steady reliability fixes.
Quiet but sharp: performance tweaks, targeted bug fixes, and prepping the runway for the Q4 surge.
The comeback arc: Capsule async lands, infra and e2e stabilizes, and year-end shipping hits turbo.

topRepos.name: captain-crash-lambda
topRepos.funFact: The “incident whisperer” repo: Slack integrations, alert filters, Rollbar/Coralogix summarization, and tons of fast iteration PRs.

topRepos.name: cloudinary
topRepos.funFact: Permissions playground: folders/assets/metadata enforcement work plus customer-impacting fixes (like OAuth + 2FA bulk delete).

topRepos.name: media_analyzer
topRepos.funFact: Home of the heavy hitters: async Capsule support (+89325/-2438) and S3-backed async responses for scalable AI analysis.

yearInReview.headline: The Year of Async + Reliability
yearInReview.tagline: 207 PRs merged, 133515 lines added, 269 reviews given — shipping big platform upgrades while keeping the fleet steady across 5 repos.
